Name: Fushimi-Inari Taisha Shrine
Description: Mountainside Shinto shrine dating from 711 A.D. featuring a path with hundreds of traditional gates

Name: Kinkaku-ji (The Golden Pavilion)
Description: Historic tranquil temple with a gold-leaf facade set amid landscaped gardens (a reflecting pond)

Name: Kiyomizu-dera Temple
Description: Iconic Buddhist temple on Mount Otowa known for the scenic views afforded from its sizable veranda

Name: Gion's Geishas and Temples
Description: Traditional shrines and temples are located throughout the district

Name: Arashiyama Monkey Park
Description: Popular area atop Mt Arashiyama for viewing wild macaque monkeys (sweeping city views)

Name: The Kyoto National Museum and Municipal Museum of Art
Description: The Kyoto National Museum was established to collect and exhibit to the public tangible cultural properties as stipulated by the Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties

Name: Kyoto Samurai and Ninja Museum
Description: Small museum with Edo-period armor (sword displays and family-friendly instruction in warrior skills)

Name: Toji
Description: Historic Buddhist temple with a 5-story wooden pagoda and sculptures of deities from the 8th century

Name: Maruyama Park
Description: Popular green space with an outdoor music hall  and bronze statues and seasonal cherry blossoms

Name: Sannenzaka Ninenzaka district of Higashiyama
Description: Its traditional architectures and beautiful stone paved road are natured in centuries of history that Ninen-zaka district eared high cultural value in the world
